description: Proposed 5 No. air conditioning units to rear of commercial property.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.	Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development shall conform in all material aspects with the plans and details shown in the application as listed below, unless variations are agreed by the Local Planning Authority in order to discharge other conditions attached to this decision:Reason:  For avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.	Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The rating level of the noise determined by the cumulative sound emissions of the plant (AC Units) hereby permitted shall be at least 5dBA lower than the existing background noise level at any given time of operation.  The noise levels shall be measured or predicted 1m externally to any window at the nearest residential facade.  Measurements and assessment shall be made according to British Standard 4142:2014.Reason: In the interest of neighbouring amenity.

Please provide a revised copy of block plan scaled 1:500, showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.

Please provide revised, existing and proposed plans at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and key dimensions for the proposed works.Please note that the scale used should also be indicated on each plan.

We have recived several copies of the plans where the title states it is RV 01 but the pages are titled as V01 10-ROMNEY-STREET-PLANS-18-09-2019-RV02.Therefore, please provide accurate 'proposed plans and elevations' indicating the scale, providing the scale bar and including dimensions for the work.

We have received 3 copies of 'Drawing sets' with the same titled RV 01. The pages are all titledas V01 10-ROMNEY-STREET-PLANS-18-09-2019-RV02.Please revise and provide 'accurately individually labelled plans and elevations' indicating and providingthe scale bar and dimensions for the work.

As part of the Agent for Change principle, this development has been provided with noise mitigation measures and supplementary ventilation.  In the event of a complaint being made to the Council of noise from the nearby sports pitches, including the 5-a-side pitches, the Council will make a formal assessment with these noise mitigation measures in place.  This will include windows being kept closed.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation.  These cover such works as  - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works.  Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts.  A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

You have been granted planning permission to build a residential extension.  When undertaking demolition and/or building work, please be considerate to your neighbours and do not undertake work before 8am or after 6pm Monday to Friday, before 8am or after 1pm on a Saturday or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.  Furthermore, please ensure that all vehicles associated with the construction of the development hereby approved are properly washed and cleaned to prevent the passage of mud and dirt onto the adjoining highway. You are advised that the Council does have formal powers to control noise and nuisance under The Control of Pollution Act 1974, the Clean Air Acts and other relevant legislation.  For further information and advice, please contact - Environmental Health Department Pollution Section.

The Party Wall Act 1996 requires a building owner to notify, and obtain formal agreement from, any adjoining owner, where the building owner proposes to:(i) carry out work to an existing party wall;(ii) build on the boundary with a neighbouring property;(iii) in some circumstances, carry out groundwork's within 6 metres of an adjoining building.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Tree evidently dying and requiring removal for health and safety purposes. A replacement should be required via condition.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Small tree to the rear of the properties, not visible to the public or contributing to public amenity. It is in poor condition and the majority of the crown is over the boundary due to an excessive lean. Works are appropriate for the purposes of health and safety and have no impact upon public amenity so the Council response should be one of no objection.Recommendation:No Objection.
trees not subject to statutory protection and therefore exempt from application.
Application withdrawn due to lack of supporting evidence. To be resubmitted at a later date following further monitoring.
